answerText: Paradise[10] Paradise is often interpreted as the third novel of a trilogy beginning with this book, whose title character is a two-year-old child murdered by the escaped slave Sethe.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 13 | 15 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, the midwife Lone DuPres is shunned for allegedly causing birth defects in the children she helps deliver. For 10 points each: [10] Name this 1997 novel which contrasts the men of the town of Ruby, Oklahoma, with women like Consolata and Pallas Truelove who live in a nearby convent.
